intro: Houstonia acerosa, commonly known as the prickly bluemink, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows in moist, woodland habitats and has lance-shaped leaves with a rough texture. Its stems are often covered in stiff, bristly hairs, which contribute to its common name. Houstonia acerosa is a short-lived perennial that plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
